net.jxta.content
Class NullContentTransfer

java.lang.Object
  net.jxta.content.NullContentTransfer
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContentTransfer
public class NullContentTransfer
extends Object
implements ContentTransfer

This class wraps an existing Content in an ContentTransfer object. All operations performed on this object are a no-op, except for the getContent() method which returns the Content with which the transfer instance was instantiated with and addContentTransferListener() which immediately notifies the attaching listener of transfer completion.

Constructor Summary
NullContentTransfer(ContentProvider origin, Content wrappedContent)
          Create a no-op wrapper for the wrappedContent specified.

getContentProvider

public ContentProvider getContentProvider()
Get the provider which created and manages this transfer.

Specified by:
getContentProvider in interface ContentTransfer
Returns:

startSourceLocation

public void startSourceLocation()
Recommend or prompt the implementation to begin the process of locating remote data sources. This process is allowed to take place independently of the transfer itself and can be used to help select a specific transfer implementation to use when used in a transfer aggregation. As the source location process implementation is entirely dependent on the transfer implementation this method is treated as an advisory and is not required to be called prior to calling startTransfer. No-op for this implementation.

Specified by:
startSourceLocation in interface ContentTransfer

stopSourceLocation

public void stopSourceLocation()
Recommend or prompt the implementation to cease the process of locating remote data sources. As the source location process implementation is entirely dependent on the transfer implementation and as the cost of source location may vary widely from provider to provider, this method is treated as advisory and is not required to be called prior to or after calling startTransfer. No-op for this implementation.

Specified by:
stopSourceLocation in interface ContentTransfer

getSourceLocationState

public ContentSourceLocationState getSourceLocationState()
Returns the current state of this transfer's remote source location activities. Always NOT_LOCATING_HAS_MANY for this implementation.

Specified by:
getSourceLocationState in interface ContentTransfer
Returns:
current source location state

startTransfer

public void startTransfer(File destination)
Begins the process of finding and retrieving the Content, storing the results into the File location specified on as as-needed basis, overwriting any pre-existing data at this location. The state of the contents of the file path provided are to be considered by the end-user to be undefined until the completion of the transfer. At transfer completion, the file should only exist if the transfer was successful and only if the ContentProvided needed to use the file location to store data. Some transfer implementations may opt to not use the file location provided, in which case the ContentProvider should ensure that the file is deleted. No-op for this implementation.

Specified by:
startTransfer in interface ContentTransfer
Parameters:
destination - file location to write the resulting data into

getTransferState

public ContentTransferState getTransferState()
Returns the current data transfer state. Always COMPLETED for this implementation.

Specified by:
getTransferState in interface ContentTransfer
Returns:
current transfer state

cancel

public void cancel()
Cancels all remote data source location and Content transfer activity, if still in progress. After a transfer has been cancelled it can no longer be used to locate sources or retrieve data. If a transfer has reached a terminal state (i.e., transferState.isFinished() returns true) then this method should have no effect. No-op for this implementation.

Specified by:
cancel in interface ContentTransfer

waitFor

public void waitFor()
Wait for the completion of the transfer. Always returns immediately for this implementation.

Specified by:
waitFor in interface ContentTransfer

waitFor

public void waitFor(long timeout)
Wait for the completion of the transfer for a maximum of timeout milliseconds. If the timeout expires, the method will return without raising an exception. Always returns immediately for this implementation.

Specified by:
waitFor in interface ContentTransfer
Parameters:
timeout - maximum amount of time to wait, in milliseconds

getContent

public Content getContent()
Blocks until the Content transfer has completed (or failed) and then returns the completed Content.

Specified by:
getContent in interface ContentTransfer
Returns:
the content used during construction of this object for this implementation.
